entry.title: Libre Office Finally Released
entry.content:
First final release of open office fork(Libre Office) has been released. It has many new features like import svg files into Draw, 1 million rows in Calc, improved slide handling layout for Impress, bundled Linux Libertine G and Linux Bilonium G font(they are nice :)), implement import of alpha channel on RGBA .tiffs and many more. I recommend you to try it. You can download Libre Office here.

Comments

Wagkangmakulit
May I know if this is better than openOffice. If so, pls. give me some information regarding the advantages and dis-advantages. I like to get rid pirated Applications and I want to convert on some freeware. Thanks.

Mark
ultrasound technician schools

entry.title: GUI Prototyping Tools For Your Application
entry.content: Before you create your real application, it's necessary to prototyping your GUI forms to give an example or illustration to the client. Pencil is a tool that can help you to create it easily. You can grab it here. It runs underlying the Gecko engine, as a firefox plugin. So, you must have firefox first before install it. Pencil can draw the common controls of a form in several design, like GTK+, Windows XP and sketch(like you are drawing it with a real pencil).
